page.title: 06 Attitudes
page.content: Villagers tend to be more broadminded, entertained and educated by the media, especially TV. Very keen on Sunday school families attend chapel together Methodism has strong roots here.C of E worshippers tend to be elderly.Another force in the community is the Jehovahs Witness.Mrs. Sweeney the shopkeeper recently started Saturday school for church and other children.Parents help and it appears to be thriving.There is no Sunday school in the village.Some farming wives plan to raise upwards of 4 children.The notion that children no longer need to be educated before junior class has lost ground over the last decade.It is not now a forgone conclusion that offspring will take up farming in fathers footsteps.Cornish people on the whole are reserved.Grand parents are expected and want to play a large part within the family unit.
